alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:04PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Rock Island, northeastern Mercer, southern Whiteside, Henry, northwestern Bureau, Scott, northeastern Muscatine and south central Clinton Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Osborn, or 9 miles east of East Moline, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, East Moline, Kewanee, Cambridge, Silvis, Geneseo, Eldridge, Milan, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Prophetstown, Hampton, Orion, Port Byron, Walcott and Erie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 282 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 39. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
